creator: urso@floripa.com.br
text:
The autoindex module produces for ç %c3%a7 and the webdav
%E7 when navigating to a directory. I am not experienced with charset 
conversion but seems to me that autoindex is using UTF and dav ISOLATIN on the 
same server. This should not match?

I tryed to change the default charset in my http.conf but this does not have 
impact on any of this encodings.

By the way, when I use %E7 I have a not found, but apache says the name of the 
directory right. 

I do not know if this is a webdav/encoding issue or it is a winnt issue.

creator: amit_athavale@persistent.co.in
text:
Could you give network trace of your requests and responses.(directory listing
of both autoindex and dav). AFAIK mod_dav should return in UTF format

Also could you specify server OS ?

creator: toscano.luca@gmail.com
text:
This issue has been in NEEDINFO for years, I believe that we could close it now. Please feel free to re-open it if you are still seeing the issue!

Thanks!

Luca
